title: Reciting Sunderkand Path This Way Might Solve All Your Problems; Know Significance And Benefits
text: - By [Kashish Rai](/authors/kashish-rai) - Updated: Fri, 29 Dec 2023 10:59 AM (IST) - Source:JND Sunderkand Path Benefits: The fifth chapter in the renowned Hindu epic Ramayana is called Sundarkand. It was originally written by the renowned sage Valmiki in Sanskrit. Afterwards, the chapter was translated into Awadhi as Ramcharitmanas by Goswami Tulsidas. Sundarkand generally refers to The Book of Splendour. This book typically depicts the grandeur of Lord Hanuman's devotion and the realisation of his abilities during the Ramayana conflict between Lord Rama and the demon King Ravana. Reciting this sacred text might also resolve oneâ€™s persistent problems. Let us check out the significance, vidhi, and benefits of chanting Sunderkand Path to seek the blessings of Lord Hanuman. Significance Of Sunderkand Path After Jamwant tells him, Lord Hanuman discovers his abilities on the Sunderkand path. In addition, he crosses the ocean and defeats demons without a curse to get to Lanka and meet Goddess Sita. This chapter tells the story of Lord Ram's devotion to his wife and how he sent Hanumana to deliver a message to her. It grants Goddess Sita bliss and ends her long-suffering. Reciting the Sunderkand Path can lead to happiness and prosperity and remove barriers from one's path. Sunderkand is one such instance that speaks of victory, hence, the one who recites it also becomes victorious. The Sunderkand Path glorifies the majesty of Lord Hanuman. (Image Source: Canva) When And How To Recite Sunderkand Path? The Sunderkand Path must be recited every Tuesday and Saturday in order to yield fruitful outcomes and bring all your sufferings to an end. Wishes come true for anyone who performs the Sunderkand Path consistently for forty weeks with reverence and sincerity. Benefits Of Reciting Sunderkand Path - Sunderkand is performed in order to appease Lord Hanuman, an embodiment of courage and strength. This is why recitation of this Path gives the reader courage and perseverance. It also bolsters confidence and resolve. - Natives with weak Mars in their Kundli may benefit from chanting Sunderkand. It boosts their determination and dispels their fears about insignificant forces or situations. - It is advised that those experiencing family issues must recite the Sunderkand Path. It fosters marriage and family balance, harmony, and empathy. Furthermore, the devotion of Lord Hanuman and the recital of Sunderkand drive off negative energy from the house.
